gate.corpora

Class CSVImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.util.AbstractFeatureBearer
      • gate.creole.AbstractResource
        • gate.gui.ResourceHelper
          • gate.corpora.CSVImporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gate.event.CreoleListener, gate.Resource, gate.util.FeatureBearer, gate.util.NameBearer, Serializable, EventListener

    @CreoleResource(name="CSV Corpus Populater",
                tool=true,
                autoinstances=,
                comment="Populate a corpus from CSV files",
                helpURL="http://gate.ac.uk/userguide/sec:creole:csv")
public class CSVImporter
extends gate.gui.ResourceHelper

      • populate

        public static void populate(gate.Corpus corpus,
            URL csv,
            String encoding,
            int column,
            boolean colLabels,
            char separator,
            char quote)
        Create a new document from each row and push it into the specified corpus
        Parameters:
        corpus - the Corpus to add documents to
        csv - the URL of the CSV file to processes
        column - the (zero index based) column which contains the text content
        colLabels - true if the first row contains column labels, true otherwise
        separator - the character that is used to separate columns (usually ,)
        quote - the character used to quote data that includes the column separator (usually ")

      • createDoc

        public static void createDoc(gate.Corpus corpus,
             URL csv,
             String encoding,
             int column,
             boolean colLabels)

      • createDoc

        public static void createDoc(gate.Corpus corpus,
             URL csv,
             String encoding,
             int column,
             boolean colLabels,
             char separator,
             char quote)
        Creates a single document from the CSV file
        Parameters:
        corpus - the Corpus to add documents to
        csv - the URL of the CSV file to processes
        column - the (zero index based) column which contains the text content
        colLabels - true if the first row contains column labels, true otherwise
        separator - the character that is used to separate columns (usually ,)
        quote - the character used to quote data that includes the column separator (usually ")
